snippet: In an appearance on “60 Minutes,” Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. said that he had no plans to run for office again and that his family was still recovering from the death of his son Beau.
abstract: Vice Pres Joseph Biden, during interview on CBS's 60 Minutes, says time it took to grieve his son's death delayed preparations necessary to mount competitive presidential campaign, leading to his decision not to run.
lead_paragraph: In an appearance on “60 Minutes,” Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. said that he had no plans to run for office again and that his family was still recovering from the death of his son Beau.

headline.print_headline: Biden’s Family Held Sway In Decision to Forgo a Bid
headline.main: Joe Biden Says Family Held Sway in Decision Not to Run
